Generate UUIDs

Source: R/uuid.R
uuid.Rd

Generate UUIDs using the uuid package. This is simply a thin wrapper around uuid::UUIDgenerate that matches the interface in the rest of the ids package.

uuid(n = 1, drop_hyphens = FALSE, use_time = NA)

Arguments

n

number of ids to return. If NULL, it instead returns the generating function
drop_hyphens

Drop the hyphens from the UUID?
use_time

Passed through to UUIDgenerate as use.time.

Examples

# Generate one id
uuid()
#> [1] "2dca3718-498f-42a0-87c2-47d18e47a183"

# Or a bunch
uuid(10)
#>  [1] "7a0d2388-68c9-41ad-a568-b8b5fb8f4d41"
#>  [2] "bdffc6d0-6c32-44c9-b786-a7e02c927fa2"
#>  [3] "2eba4c5a-5f4b-4855-b766-b24d12212302"
#>  [4] "857fcf04-e2de-4dd8-8c07-077d40f094ba"
#>  [5] "921dc51e-a449-4c55-a89a-2b4a63eca0ab"
#>  [6] "6678169e-d8a9-455b-9462-56a247f92cf4"
#>  [7] "d6f1755b-bb99-4d18-9f0c-ac06c0e0dfec"
#>  [8] "626f7f18-0cc6-4375-abec-bb96c972f2e7"
#>  [9] "05a15c0b-a253-4ed5-aa82-b56e8f7c0e7c"
#> [10] "ff703a26-edfe-4a85-a28a-72cc9a1af9f6"

# More in the style of random_id()
uuid(drop_hyphens = TRUE)
#> [1] "a0e437cdc7b340b89b2e42a353e30725"
